Text:
Look at all of these fish! Eeheehee, and it's all
thanks to my gifted instructor.

The same goes for me. I think my favorite is this one
with the big tail fin.

This small fellow is very brave and cute as well,
don't you think? I need to come up with a name.

Glad you both had fun. So, can we consider this
"duel" over?

Why, I'm having such a good time that making things
into any sort of competition is beginning to seem
rather droll. What say you, Violet?

I agree. The duel was only ever meant to add a bit of
spice to the fun, after all.

In that case, it's time you started helping with
talking to the ghosts.
Oh, right, that was our main goal, wasn't it.
...Says the one who mentioned it in the first place.

Just joking. I'd never leave all the work to you. But
the festival in this world is just so fun that
honestly I'd rather just keep on enjoying it.

Goodness, yes, I understand completely. Modern
festivals offer so very much to see.
I do get where you're coming from, yeah.

Of course you do. And in that light, it makes it all
the more sad that we have to spoil the fun of the
deceased as well.

It was the energy of the festival that called them
here, after all. They haven't done any harm, so I
only wish there was a way we could all relish this
moment in time together...

Yes, I agree. It would be so nice to offer those of
the distant past a brief moment of comfort.
Elisabeth?

...Oh, I just had a passing thought. That it would
have been so nice to have festivals like this during
my reign.

If only I could have enjoyed such peaceful moments of
merrymaking with old friends and subjects, all of us
as equals... But this is nothing I haven't said
before.

Indeed. Sadly, that sight didn't become a reality in
our day.

But it did now, all this time later. That's not so
bad, is it?

You have the right of it, Violet. We must make sure
this festive night ends on an even higher note.

Dragging our feet to prolong the end won't make the
fun last forever, either. If they have somewhere to
return to, then return they must.
And what happens if they don't?

Their sense of self and purpose will gradually fade,
leaving them nothing more than wandering spirits.

Some will likely seek out the living from loneliness,
while others may be driven by envy to do harm.

All with no end, no sense of self... How pitiful to
become a being that only causes injury to others.

Indeed. All the more reason why we must urge them to
go back from where they came.
You guys...

(So they aren't just caught up in the festival.
They're really putting thought into this.)

(Well, they won't outdo me! I gotta make a shadow
operative move, protecting everyone by secretly
busting ghosts on the night of the busy festival!)

All right, playtime's over, you two. From here on, we
need to focus on sending the dead home in a way that
doesn't alert the normal folks around us.
Someone sure is motivated now.

So you have compassion even for the deceased. What a
gentle soul you are...

(...I think they're reading me wrong, but hey, at
least they seem enthused now.)

Now, are we working under any kind of time limit
here?

I...think it would be best to consider the end of the
festival our limit. After all, the festival is what
brought us here.

It would probably be safe to assume that the drawn
here will only be in their right minds while the
festival is underway.

I can almost guarantee that once it's over, they'll
begin to lose their focus...

Okay...so how about we set the fireworks at the end
of the festival as our deadline?

Yes, that sounds reasonable. We can split up and
seek out the ghosts individually.

Now, let's get down to business. It's time to send
these spirits on their way.
